data.event: Au is first mentioned in 1316 as Diken Auwe.

event.title: 2007, about 33.3% of the population was made

data.event: As of 2007, about 33.3% of the population was made up of foreign nationals.
Most of the population (as of 2000) speaks German (87.0%), with Italian being second most common ( 3.0%) and Albanian being third ( 2.5%).
Of the Swiss national languages (as of 2000), 5,577 speak German, 21 people speak French, 190 people speak Italian, and 7 people speak Romansh.
